thread.title: India coach blames debacle on lack of preparations
thread.title_full: India coach blames debacle on lack of preparations

author: muscatdaily@apexmedia.co.om (Muscat Daily News)
title: India coach blames debacle on lack of preparations
text:
India coach blames debacle on lack of preparations Stephen Constantine Muscat Daily staff writer October 14, 2015 
India coach Stephen Constantine lamented the lack of preparations for his team ahead of the two back-to-back away joint qualifiers for the 2018 World Cup and the 2019 Asian Cup. 
India lost 1-2 at Turkmenistan last week before getting drubbed at the hands of Oman on Tuesday to wrap up a forgettable trip. 
Constantine said, “It was a difficult match for us as we had very little time to prepare for both the qualifiers. In total, we had just four and a half hours of training before the Oman game.” 
The Englishman added, “My players did well to hold Oman in the first half, credit to their work rate and hard work. But in the second session, they ran out of gas as they were not physically in their best shape.” 
He said, “The players gave everything and I am proud of their excellent effort, but they did not have the fitness to match the Omani players. Had the boys had good preparations, I think we could have got a different result.” 
The coach is hopeful of India making it to the Asian Cup as he is targeting a total of six points from its home games against Guam and Turkmenistan. 
He also had a word of praise for goalkeeper Gurpreet Singh Sandhu for having a ‘decent outing’ in Muscat. Similar content
